website_summaries.verdict: An essential oil-based spray for dogs (NOT cats) that fight against fleas, ticks, and mosquitoes. The maker has a separate formula without clove oil for cats.
pros: Available in varying sizes based on your need
cons: It should not be used on cats

customer_reviews.title: Worked instantly!
customer_reviews.text: WATCHING THIS PRODUCT WORK IS INSANE. My neighbors behind my house like to go hunting for wild boars and that brought LOTS of fleas to my dog. I felt so sad for him! His coat is not near as nice as it used to be. I originally got this for inside the house because I feel like I just get eaten alive! I used it on my dog first and you can see it WORKING INSTANTLY! All of the fleas were coming up to the surface and dead! It was crazy! I took a video of it too because I just couldn't believe it. I took a couple screen shots from the video I took!
customer_reviews.author: Liz S.

customer_reviews.title: ZERO effect.  don't believe the fake positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: are 4 stars and 5 stars reviewers get paid to make fake reviews? I bought this based on the positive feedback and left disappointed. I spray this on my dog with a generous amount and directly onto the flea. It has no effect. Wish Amazon can do something about all the fake reviews.
customer_reviews.author: C. W

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING TICK PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING TICK PRODUCT!!!! I don't use anything else on my dogs except for this spray once a week and it does the job perfectly! I live in a heavily wooded area in New Jersey and the ticks have been crazy lately! But ever since I started using this spray I haven't found a tick on any of my dogs. It's all natural and smells so amazing. Love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION! May be toxic!
customer_reviews.text: My adult dog had a serious reaction to this product. Peppermint oil is listed as a toxin by the ASPCA. Don’t assume that you can safely spray bedding, let alone your dog. I sprayed an entry rug she likes to nap on and she developed strange symptoms within an hour. It included lameness that changed sides an extreme lethargy. Tests for Lyme were negative. She appeared to have allergies to something and removing everything I’d sprayed and washing the area and her started recovery. Don’t rely on the label.
customer_reviews.author: E. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Flea lived over 1/2 hour in it.
customer_reviews.text: I spraid some of this in a cupb dropped a live flea down in it and that flea swam around in it for a good half our without dying! Wth? Yup, Swimmin around in it like he was on vacation in the Bahamas or something. I was just about ready to make it a little margarita or something. I will NOT be buying this again....
customer_reviews.author: Keri Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Do not spray this on your dog. Has caused ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not spray this on your dog. Has caused my dogs skin to turn very red and irritated and has made it peel.
customer_reviews.author: tyler head

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work. Our cat spent most of her time lounging in my husband's home office. After a few weeks my husband noticed fleas jumping on him. We sprayed the room with this product many times but the fleas are still there. We got rid of the fleas on our cat by giving her an oral product (in her water) and haven't let her outside since. My husband says when he sprays, the fleas don't jump on him for the rest of the day, but then they are back the next day. (It does repel the cat though!)
customer_reviews.author: Yarbie68

customer_reviews.title: YES IT DOES WORK!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about this becz of the mixed reviews, we have fleas outside the back of our building from stray cats and i did not want to bring any stray fleas inside... when i took out the recycling i would see them on my socks so i sprayed this directly on my socks and they all dropped off!!!! (see photo) most were dead others were clinging to the last of life so i taped them in so i could take this pic best of all is that i did not have any problems with a rash on my skin or anything and i have sensitive skin too!!!! (eczema)
customer_reviews.author: danusha

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, you could buy flea products that contained chemicals which actually killed fleas/ticks. Nowadays, you can only find flea sprays made with non-chemicals (but, that is impossible, because everything is a from of chemical, atomically speaking). This spray is basically menthol-scented toilet water. The fleas seems to react as if it is a cologne, especially designed for fleas. I notice it doesn't kill any, nor keep any away. The only teeny positive (1 star) is that the dog and cat hate it so much that they refuse to chew the area of their body sprayed, at least for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: hotchas

customer_reviews.title: Not effective
customer_reviews.text: Smells nice it did not seem effective on my puppy she was still itching a lot after using this product. This product also irritated her skin. I like the smell of the product. I tried apple cider vinegar on my puppy to stop fleas and it seems to work, just make sure to dilute it before applying to skin. You can mix apple cider vinegar and water in a spray bottle and spray on dogs a few times a week. Or you can even give them an apple cider vinegar rinse after you bathe them this keeps the fleas away and makes coat shine and silky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for flies and mosquitoes specifically. I sprayed it in my backyard and let it sit for a few minutes, and even as a test, sprayed my legs. Within minutes, I was being attacked by mosquitoes and the flies were back. This product does not work at all. The mosquitoes were all over my dogs, my yard, everything, and the flies were hovering around my grill. Waste of money. Would not recommend. As a side note, I live in the city, so not deep in the woods or anything crazy. This product just doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Product is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Besides making my dogs, cat and house smell like a knock off version of Girl Scout cookies this stuff does nothing. I think I made my animals more tasty for the fleas. I’d spray them it would get all sudsy as I worked it into the animals coat to get down to the skin. It would make them go crazy and roll all over figured hey that must mean it’s working. I didn’t find one dead flea. I gave it a chance since I bought two bottles. Now I have a bigger flea problem from all that wasted time using this. Skip it and try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Strait

customer_reviews.title: Better than seresto!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very adventurous pitbull who I allow to be unleashed on our 8.5 acre property. He LOVES to go in the woods. I always buy the Seresto collar, but this season I was still pulling off at least one tick a day. Bought this bottle after doing some research online and we haven't seen a tick on him since!! I spray my dog about once a week. He smells like a nursing home for a little bit, but it's well worth not having ticks on him!
customer_reviews.author: Justine

customer_reviews.title: Which I hated to do because we aren’t infested that bad
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work. I sprayed everywhere I have carpet. Which is my living room and bedrooms. Sprayed the dogs beds, my bedding, and the kids bedding. Even sprayed it on the dogs. And guess what?we still have fleas :( going to just have to give in and bomb the home. Which I hated to do because we aren’t infested that bad. Oh and the smell reaks. It’s a very strong, overpowering smell. We had to leave the house for a bit after I sprayed which totally defeated the purpose. If I knew this, I would’ve bombed to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: works but makes my dog itch
customer_reviews.text: why does this and the spray bottle make a soap like consistency on my dog even rinsing it off created MORE suds?, and it was NOT the shampoo version....however it does work gets rid of fleas, just be careful if you or anyone in the home has allergies or asthma, the spray bottle for home and pet use along with the gallon version makes some of my family members cough for a few min. However the contentious spray for dogs has NO suds and LESS smell MAKE SURE IF TO NOT USE THE ONE MADE FOR DOGS ON A CAT , THIS CAN HARM YOUR CAT DUE TO VARIOUS ESSENTIAL OILS!!
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Watch it work! Smells lovely!
customer_reviews.text: I am SHOCKED at how fast this works! We tried bombing our house - TWICE. And have our dog Nexguard and our cat comfortis. it wasn't helping, and I've never had preventative not work. So I ordered this based on the reviews. And I was not disappointed! My boyfriend said he was giving our dog a flea bath...and he wasn't kidding. 😂 This stuff suds up when you massage it into their fur, but it soaks in and dries up! Makes their coat shiny, too. And kills fleas ON CONTACT. I enjoy the smell (like cloves!) And the dog or cat don't mind it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis R

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely does NOT work
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try this product with decent reviews. It does not kill fleas at all. Has a strong smell of cloves which is not unpleasant for me. Upon receipt, I sprayed dog beds and dog. Flea infestation continued through the next day with no slow down reapplied after a couple days, same no slow down of fleas, after a couple more days I drenched my dog with the spray where it was dripping off of him still no slow down. I captured some fleas and put them in a jar with this spray this still did not kill them. soap and water do a better job of killing fleas.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with ticks
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how well it is working yet. Haven't noticed a major difference with fleas decreasing in our home or on our pet. Will update if anything changes. Says it kills fleas, flea eggs and TICKS by contact. Well I saw a tick on my dog and picked it off with some tweezers then put in a cup and sprayed it with vets best flea and tick spray to see if it actually does anything to it. 30 mins later the tick is still alive
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: smells like christmas, non toxic
customer_reviews.text: I'm being generous with the second star. I have 4 dogs so hear me out: Pros: smells like christmas, non toxic, natural Cons: does NOT kill fleas, messy, does not repel this spray smells like a mixture of natural remedies that was crafted somewhere out in the deep woods but it doesn't do much for the dogs itself. The fleas pop up on the fur when you spray it, making them visible and easy to comb out with a flea comb but it does not kill fleas at all. It is mainly a temporary flea stunner. Also, since you reapply it to the dogs, their coat gets kind of messy and you will have to wash them more often.
customer_reviews.author: Ive

customer_reviews.title: Worked immediately!!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this after trying numerous other products after reading all the great reviews. My poor dog was suffering and couldn't sleep more than 10 minutes because he was scratching and biting himself for the pst couple months. Nothing I tried seemed to help him or get rid of the fleas. I got this less than 2 hours ago and sprayed him immediately! I am happy to say that he is sleeping soundly and hasn't moved for over an hour!! I found a flea on his bed and sprayed it, it killed it instantly. I will now try to spray the cat, this will be an adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Plant based flea tick spray
customer_reviews.text: This product is new to me. I did use on my dog, (tick and flea season) who is always out in the fields and creeks. I have used it on the horses which work great keeping the flies off them. Finally tried it on myself, it kept the mosquitos away at dusk. It didn’t irritate or sting my skin the scent isn’t bad. I like the fact it’s made from natural oils, and here in the USA . PS have not found any ticks or fleas on the dog, horses, or me!
customer_reviews.author: Iwork4docs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mental satisfaction while killing fleas
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this product 10 stars if possible. It just gives me so much mental satisfaction while using it. I had used all kinds of method to get rid of flea on my puppy such as topical drops, flea collar, medicated bath.. etc. None of them was effective. This product is basically executing the horrible critters by shooting the liquid. The formula kills fleas on contact, it's easy to take them out by hand (because they don't freaking move and hide anymore!!), but I pop them with my nails once more just to make sure they are dead. Ahhhh.. such bliss...
customer_reviews.author: Xlnoodle

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy...Bayer flea & tick collar may be more expensive but works great on our two large, pampered dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Same as my earlier comments on the “Vet’s Best Flea and Tick Wipes”. Highly ineffective for our two large dogs since we seem to be getting more fleas after application. Is this product really “veterinarian’s best” remedy against fleas and ticks or just part of the product name to falsely imply a claim?
customer_reviews.author: George H. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't happy
customer_reviews.text: I read so many great reviews on this product and thought that I had finally found something that was natural and would help keep fleas off my pets. When I sprayed it on my dog I did see that the fleas came to the surface. However, they did not die. As soon as the smell wasn't as strong and I mean the smell on this product is really strong! They went back into the fur. Also this product says it can be used around cats. This product contains clove extract which is very toxic to cats. I'm glad that I read the ingredients fully before spraying in a round where my cats sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum With this For A++ Results
customer_reviews.text: This spray smells like Christmas, I also did several tests and found that it indeed did kill on contact, I had no issues with the container leaking whatsoever. I would highly recommend that you all vacuum a few times and use this to spray all along walls and corners heavily for best results. Also!! It should be worth noting that about a week after running out of spray we found a couch in a seldom-used room of the house that had all the fleas in it, so check for breeding grounds BEFORE going through 4 bottles. lol
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: This works good but works better AFTER a flea bath is given to your dog. After the bath and the fleas were gone I took my dog for a walk and a few fleas got on her. I sprayed her with this and rubbed it in and about 30 minutes later she stopped scratching and I couldn’t find any fleas on her. I sprayed her blanket and was able to see dead fleas when I went back after about an hour. I’ve combined this as a secondary with flea treatment and it seems to be working well. I check my dog after her walks and if I see any fleas I spray her. The scent is also pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in conjunction with a monthly flea treatment for dogs when we got a severe flea infestation this spring. It works wonders! I sprayed it on furniture, carpets, bedding, the yard and the dog. Fleas die within a few seconds once they are sprayed. It took a good month of consistent treatment, but we have been flea free this summer! I still do spot treatments where the dog spends most of her time, just as a precaution. Living out in the country, i didnt think we would ever be free of the fleas!
customer_reviews.author: My Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Works well and has a Very pleasant scent !
customer_reviews.text: Being someone who is VERY sensitive to certain smells, I was very hesitant to give this a try. Decided to go ahead and give it a go though . Very pleased ! The scent is great , sorry I can’t describe it very well, but while it’s not flowery or chemically like so many, it Is very pleasant ! We live in a deep mountainous wooded area. TBH I Have found two ticks on my dog so far , but I may have forgotten to spray her those times. Can’t recall for sure . But no other pests at all, and only two is excellent ! It’s lasted a good while
customer_reviews.author: Dorrie

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK! Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work at all, honest to goodness. Been using it for a month now all over the house, and there are still fleas everywhere, without any sign of them dying down (and our flea problem isn't even that big). This stuff is nothing more than quackery, that's all. I wanted it to work, but after month of using it (went through 4 bottles), I can say for 100% certain that it DOES NOT WORK at all!
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Wrangler TJ Forum

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Repel nor Kill Ticks
customer_reviews.text: We live in a wooded area, next to a park and my dog is with me in the woods every day. This year is exceptionally bad with ticks. I spray him with this spray every time we go out. He still picks up ticks, no different than he did before. I have sprayed the ticks with the spray and it doesn't even repel them.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R Thompson

customer_reviews.title: You have to be semi-consistant
customer_reviews.text: Biggest take away's from this product is that you must keep your dog well groomed to begin with. If your dog sheds a lot, then getting this could be a waste. You also have to be semi consistent. For our dog in the summer, this was about every 4 days. The scent isn't bad; it doesn't smell like chemicals. My wife doesn't like the smell though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: After dog brought fleas into house, I tried this natural product for two weeks (used two bottles). As far as I can tell, it energized the fleas and encouraged their procreation. The only flea I saw die was when I sprayed enough to drown it. Skip this product and just buy a chemical-based spray such as Adams Flea/Tick Home Spray or PetArmor Home and Carpet Spray. They worked great after a couple applications. Fleas are tough, resistant, and are constantly laying eggs. Don't experiment, just go straight for the kill.
customer_reviews.author: Martin C.

customer_reviews.title: ITCHY DOGS
customer_reviews.text: Horrible !!!! Two dogs became 10x itchier after a day or two of starting use of this. Massive bald spots and seeping wounds. One dog had a severe allergic reaction, had to bathe immidiatly to get this stuff off. The smell is terrible and overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Greer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of works
customer_reviews.text: In order for you to actually see it work, you have to drown the fleas. My cat and his out doorsy self had fleas on my house. Partially my fault (no flea and tick control?. My house had fleas. I purchased this product just reading some of the reviews. I can say, it does work on occasion. I has helped get rid of some of the bugs slowly. Unfortunately, fleas don't care who they jump on. I had to spray myself. LOL. I had no skin irritations thank you. I can say that for the amount that I paid for it, It wasn't too much of a bad deal. Better than bombing your house.
customer_reviews.author: thetrueone83

customer_reviews.title: Good All Natural Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Our one dog is allergic to the stuff you put on the back of their necks, so I decided to try this. You do have to put it on every time you plan on letting your dogs run around in possible flea/tick areas (and they will smell like cloves), so it's not like the stuff that lasts for a month. I have actually sprayed a tick full of this stuff and left it in a ziploc bag - and sure enough, it died =)
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Peterman

customer_reviews.title: Good product but accident while shipping.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It works well, great smell, seems to have gotten rid of fleas my dog caught from other another dog(s) in literally one application ( to the furniture, bed, you box, etc) and a bath. I looove the scent, makes my home smell like fresh mint. I expected a very chemical scent and was worried about applying it directly to my pet but I stand corrected, it isn't harsh and very natural. I must say that the bottle came open and half of the formula was about wasted. Hopefully they get back to me on that. Besides that, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Tr3y

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!! WARNING!! WARNING!! NOT FOR CATS!!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR CATS!!! NOT FOR CATS!!! PLEASE DO NOT USE ON CATS!!! VERY TOXIC TO THEM!!! I sprayed my 2 cats for fleas and next day they were lethargic, drooling, couldn't eat or drink and throwing up. Had to take them to vet emergency and after $816 bill she told me this product is highly toxic and might have done some liver damage. Essential oils are toxic to cats, which is what this product has!!! Did not kill fleas either! Product should have very specific and prominent WARNING label. Various other reviewers have had their cats die after using this product; read their reviews please. Somebody should sue them!!!
customer_reviews.author: alejoviejo

customer_reviews.title: A great product.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for years. I don't know how it would work if you had a big flea issue. I use it at the first sign of an issue, as part of treating the animals. It's always worked great for us. Spraying furniture, carpets, and dog beds. I first purchased at my vet for significantly more money. I was happy to find it on Amazon. I like that it works and it's safe to use with my toddler grandchildren in and out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Rayne.

customer_reviews.title: It works and its safe!
customer_reviews.text: Came to visit a friend in wisconsin found the room i was staying in was infested with fleas i got bit 12 times in 1 night!! I sprayed this product all over the room and on bedding and BAM the next night i was able to sleep and no more new bites!! Its a VERY safe product also. The smell of cloves and peppermint is very strong you might want to open windows afterwards for awhile if that bothers you.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Klibowitz

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Brought this because of the dual-use for Home and Directly on pets. The first time, I followed the directions and no effect. The second time, looked up some reviews and practically drenched the beasts in the stuff as most people suggested this. Still no effect. Still fleas on all of them. Bought the companion product for cats and have returned it unused and unopened. The smell is strong but okay at first. Then it morphs into a spicy odor that irritated me. I could have lived with that; IF THE PRODUCT HAD WORKED.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Spruill

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product. Good alternative to toxic chemical flea products on market
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something to spray on dogs/around home that was more natural unlike the other products you can buy that are very toxic and unhealthy to have anywhere near you let alone in your home/on your furniture! Sprayed this all over my dogs a couple days in a row and did the trick with getting rid of fleas. They were pretty bad too. Would recommend but as an additional treatment to actually treating your pet for fleas. Not as a stand alone intervention. Got to get the fleas from every angle! Or they will keep coming back.
customer_reviews.author: Caz

customer_reviews.title: Killed them on my dog immediately
customer_reviews.text: The scent was a bit strong, I didn’t mind it but I did have a couple of complaints from others of peppermint wafting about. The fleas died immediately, and there were hundreds on my dog. I gave him one cap star flea chewable treatment to keep them off for the rest of the day while I try to vacuum as much as possible up. I also purchased Bayer K9 advantix flea treatment to help combat the infestation. I don’t know for certain if spraying on the floor helps or not but I definitely sprayed anyway and also hit the pets bed. They weren’t happy but it has to be done
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs one 2 out of the 3 are outdoor dogs. We're currently training a puppy indoors and when he goes out he picks up fleas. I've purchased collars that don't work and this kills on contact it's so amazing. Will be purchasing more in the future. My dogs don't like being sprayed but I love that fleas literally fall off and dead and not to mention the smell is also amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Vet's Best Flea and Tick Home Spray/Flea Treatment for Dogs and Home
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for about 7 years now. It is effective and smells good, although the smell is a bit overpowering. I use it on my dog after bathing twice a month. I also use it on my dog's bedding, our mattress when changing sheets, and upholstered furniture throughout the house about 2x a month. This way fleas don't stand a chance inside the house. With that being said, it isn't a cure-all. I still use generic fiproguard on my dog every 30-45 days and make sure to treat the backyard with Bayer Advance granules.
customer_reviews.author: Christina C

customer_reviews.title: Well, it definitely kills fleas. We tested it!
customer_reviews.text: I swear that fleas we encountered have become immune to all the flea medication out there. Dawn soap seems to suffocate them, but I can’t leave that on the dogs. Finally, I tried this! And I had to know for sure, so I tested it on some fleas that were attacking my dog. After being touched by the spray, the fleas died in around 10-40 seconds. The scent is SUPER strong and makes me cough when a lot is sprayed, but I think that’s just how peppermint oil is. It works, so I will deal with it. My poor has been suffering for too long. It lathers up, foamy like soap, so don’t be shocked.
customer_reviews.author: Elvia Elizabeth Olvera

customer_reviews.title: It really seems to work!
customer_reviews.text: It really seems to work. We had to move temporarily to a home infested with fleas and our Maltese became infected. When we returned home, I purchased this and it worked instantly. I just bathed her and sprayed bedding with this and wow!No more fleas! I never had to spray it on her directly at all.
customer_reviews.author: LUCILLE L.

customer_reviews.title: Don't continue wasting money, as a homeowner with three cats, this WORKS
customer_reviews.text: This product WORKS! We use it weekly on our carpets and bedding when the fleas appear...no matter what we've tried in the past and present, there is no preventing their arrival since we have three cats. The scent is strong but I don't consider it to be overpowering. We use coconut oil on our cats and in combination with this home spray, we're able to combat them! It's a great feeling knowing we can do it "naturally" and without harsh medications or chemicals. We'll always buy!
customer_reviews.author: Krista R. Hanner

customer_reviews.title: Does the job !
customer_reviews.text: We got this because unfortunately our dog had some fleas. We also wanted something we could use around the house. The scent is very strong, that’s the major downside to this product in my honest opinion. I personally think this product works well- I sprayed once and massaged the product into my dog’s skin per the instructions on the bottle and these little ticks dropped dead instantly. Our dog has been happier and we also sprayed the covers on the couches and they were also gone! I will definitely purchase again. Just beware of that scent.
customer_reviews.author: k. a.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to deter fleas...but kills on contact
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. My dog is an outdoor Blue Tick and gets into all kinds of stuff. I wish it had a greater deterrent effect. I have to treat my dog daily to kill fleas. It does kill on contact and does a very good job of that. The odor is quite pleasing to me, it's the odor of the Eugenol (clove oil). Doesn't seem to dry his skin, he not itchy except from the fleas. If used on a daily basis it does a great job. I also treat his bedding with it. Bonus effect it seems to deter flies from bothering him as well.
customer_reviews.author: Crocketd

customer_reviews.title: We shall see
customer_reviews.text: The main thing I will say about this is, if you plan on spraying this all throughout your house make sure to open some windows and put on some fans because man this stuff is very strong smelling. So strong it upsets my stomache. Hoping this will help get rid of fleas in my house, but I probably wont be able to use this on my dog. I sprayed the floor where he lays hours before bed and shortly after we layed down he threw up so I'm thinking it's a little strong for him as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia kisel

customer_reviews.title: Greta for getting fleas out of your home
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever lived in the south not in a large city, you have had flees get in your home. This stuff has a mint smell, not to strong. But we have had to use this on a couple of occasions in the summers when we get alot of ran and the flees will load up yards. This stuff will swiftly invite them to leave your home and keep them out without any harsh smells or chemicals so the kiddo is safe and so are our pets. Does not stain furniture either. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: kristine

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!!!!!!!? OFFICIAL M.MCKENNA REVIEW*****
customer_reviews.text: 5 STARS!!!!!!!! I JUST RECIEVED MY FIRST 32 OZ. SPRAY BOTTLE AND IMMEDIATELY APPLIED IT TO MY 2 BICHONS. I'M AMAZED AT HOW QUICKLY IT COMPLETELY KILLED THEIR FLEAS!!! ON CONTACT THE FLEAS IMMEDIATELY DIED, NOT HALF DEAD,BUT COMPLETELY DEAD!!!! SPRAYED ON THEIR COATS , MASSAGED IN THE GREAT SMELLING FOAMING SOLUTION AND GOOD BUY FLEAS!!!!! THIS PRODUCT WORKS SO WELL 👍 THAT I IMMEDIATELY NEEDED TO WRITE THIS REVIEW. NO NEED TO LOOK ELSEWHERE. 1. COST EFFECTIVE 2. FAST ACTING 3.GREAT SCENT 4. DOGS HAD NO NEGATIVE REACTION DURING APPLICATION OR AFTERWARDS. 5.NON-STAINING ETC.ETC.ETC. THE BEST, EASIEST, FLEA PRODUCT I HAVE EVER FOUND!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: M.McKennaJr.

customer_reviews.title: I have used this for years on my pets because ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for years on my pets because I don't agree with putting all the chemicals on my dogs just to keep fleas and ticks away. This has done the job but I also spray my pets heavily with this before going out to walk in the woods and when I come home I bath them. I have never had issues with fleas or ticks, only found a few in the last five years using this.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Go to your vet and buy what they recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This product kind of worked on my maltese. It did not kill all of the fleas, but it did kill some. It did not protect him from future fleas jumping on him. My other 2 dogs on the other hand, this did nothing for them. Their hair actually fell out where they were sprayed😫 I have not tried spraying on any furniture, but I believe it could work if sprayed directly on the fleas. I do not however recommend this on your pets.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR CATS
customer_reviews.text: This product says in the description it’s targeted for cats. I read the back and did not spray it on my cats because it only mentioned spray it on dogs. I sprayed it all around my house and so far my cat’s haven’t showed symptoms, but it’s ingredients are toxic to cats! I’m going watch my cats closely but I would not have wasted my money if I had known it would have possibly posed a risk to them! I’m angry that I wasted my money and risked my cats health because of false advertising. They need a clear label that it poses risks to cats
customer_reviews.author: CamJack

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted it to work
customer_reviews.text: We looked for a long time to find something that would work to keep the fleas out. This stuff may work but only if you had a small indoor dog that's happened to pick up the I'd flea at the dog park. If your land has rabbits or ground squirrels and the fleas are a real problem don't waist your money. I really wish this did work because who want chemicals on their dog or around their house. The smell is not nice and strong enough to make you feel sick from the intensity. So it's back to Advantix and spraying the yard and putting natural insect repellents on the baby.
customer_reviews.author: D. Twigden

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work. Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Used on my dog and around home. Very strong odor. Burns. Used all over dog and didn't work. Repeated many times. Made her coat sticky and smell awful. Had to bath her many times. Can kill cats - so don't use on cats. Expert advised that these products can make fleas infestations worse because they create a "soapy" layer over fabrics which can create a moist warm environment for flea eggs to thrive. Left carpets and rugs looking dirty and dingy. Had to steam clean everything. Don't waste your money. Just get a flea preventative/killer from vet and be done. This product lead to a massive flea infestation in my home. Worse than before purchased.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: I DON'T UNDERSTAND
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the glowing reviews I am somewhat astounded. What the heck am I doing wrong. Our flea problem is due to pesky squirrels living in our oak trees and constantly roaming our backyard. A good bath for our pet and then treatment made him smell great, but it does not appear to kill the fleas that ultimately get on him when he goes outside. I have also not seen any fleas fleeing after he is treated as others have indicated. Really wanted a non toxic product as I believe in natural products, but this stuff is like spraying a flea attractant instead of something that rids your pet of the pesky critters. Money wasted I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M

customer_reviews.title: 0*  DANGEROUS!!! DON’T BUY  Save your pets eyes!
customer_reviews.text: Being an herbalist I was looking for a natural alternative to flea problems, after just ONE use of this intense clove oxides product, my poor baby’s eyes won’t open!! I’m furious and devastated and pray my dog isn’t blind from this horrendous product. Taking her to the Vet ASAP! ABSOLUTE WORST PRODUCT EVER :,( Oh, side note: I think the fleas liked it and was not deterred by it.
customer_reviews.author: Honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: It Actually Works
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wasn't expecting much but I was getting a little desperate because the fleas were out of control. My dog bring a couple of fleas home from the vet and suddenly is a Flea Coachella in my house. Flea collars were a bust, CapStar helped, but this spray was the real Superhero. I sprayed it on a little flea gathering and they fricken melted. MELTED. I felt bad for about two seconds and then sprayed everything I owned. It smells like Christmas for a couple days but no more Flea Coachella.
customer_reviews.author: GmaKraken

customer_reviews.title: Say hello to my little friend...
customer_reviews.text: Like Al Pacino in the movie Scarface, I'm going outside with a smug smile knowing that these bugs don't stand a chance. So far I've used this Vet's Best spray on spiders, silverfish and ants, and it stops em dead in their tracks. With spiders, sometimes it takes a second spritzing to finish the job, but ultimately they are no match. The fact that this spray is also safe for humans and pets and smells nice is a big plus. I haven't had to use it for its advertised purpose of killing fleas and ticks yet, but if it works so well on other stuff, I can't imagine it being less than stellar in living up to its stated function.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wong

customer_reviews.title: does nothing for fleas and peppermint oil is bad for cats
customer_reviews.text: does nothing for fleas and peppermint oil is bad for cats. Essential Oils Potentially Toxic to Cats Peppermint. Lemon Oil. Lavender Oil. Melaleuca Oil. Tea Tree Oil. Cinnamon Bark Oil. Wintergreen Oil. Thyme Oil.
customer_reviews.author: 7r432000

customer_reviews.title: Works but not recommended
customer_reviews.text: My pitbull got the fleas and it was bad. We showered him in this and it worked. It kill the fleas instantly. But it still did not solve our issue. You literally would have to spray your whole house and not miss a spot. Or else they will just keeping finding their way to our poor dog. We took our pitbull to the vet finally and they prescribed prescription pills. And our flea issue was solved. No need to waste money on other products
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews and was looking for something "natural " since I have kids, everybody says pleasant smell but to me it was so strong it made me nauseous. I sprayed my entire house and left windows open. When I came back fleas still around so I guess this product is good if you need to kill them on contact (one by one) I already used it twice and would continue to use to see better results but the smell I can't handle.
customer_reviews.author: prncez1921

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a product!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW, Works better than advertised. It kills fleas on contact. Just like it says It Killed the fleas on our to babies instantly. Then we sprayed our rugs and furniture and HOLY COW the amount of fleas that came out in the vacuum after the spray dried. It is son good. We bought frontline for a ridiculous amount of money it didnt do anything that this pet miracle did for way less. Great Job Vets Best.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: A Great Way to Eliminate Fleas
customer_reviews.text: We adopted three cats. But our county is awash in feral cats... so there are cats everywhere. And where there are cats, there are fleas. Vet's Best seems to do a good job in keeping fleas at bay. We treat our rugs regularly... and our cats as needed. The formula does the rest. We've had flea problems in the past, but not so much since discovering Vet's Best. When we treat our rugs regularly, we see a lot less fleas. Best of all, treating the rugs leaves the house smelling like cloves. So guests think we've been baking instead of treating for fleas.
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a few fleas from playing out in the yard. I have purchased this and the lawn spray and I have noticed it works very fast. I sprayed my dog and immediately there was a few fleas dead coming off of her. I think I over sprayed the first time but I rinsed her off outside. She hardly scratches anymore. Also sprayed my couches, no stains were left behind. Scent isnt too bad if used in moderation.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: POISONOUS TO CATS
customer_reviews.text: It smells good. But it's advertised as safe for cats. It has peppermint oil in it which is DEADLY to cats. I can't speak for how it works for dogs, but it made my cats really sick. Thank goodness i read the ingredients after one use. Please take off the advertisement for cats.... someone who doesn't know peppermint oil is dangerous could end up poisoning and losing their cats. I'm disappointed i can't use it, it smells great and has no harsh chemicals for humans, but it's not safe even in small amounts for cats at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cc

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: For the very first time my 11 year old dog was infected with fleas! I bathed her with special flea shampoo, It did something but not enough. The war against fleas started! I could see the fleas and eggs on her bed., I soaked my poor dog in the tub sometimes 2× day (without shampoo) They were coming out like crazy, about 50 fleas with each bath, definitely was helping but not enough. Decided to buy flea & tick home spray. Put my dog in the bathroom, followed directions and buum! they were falling on the floor, more and more were coming out! I highly recommend this product. It works!! Smell is not bad, strong but totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ximena

customer_reviews.title: Only works while it's still wet and attracted more flea's
customer_reviews.text: This has a good scent but doesn't work except for when you first put it on it does kill and weaken the fleas at first contact. My dogs hated it. They whined like it was burning where the fleas had bit them and my chorkie ended up with breathing problems from it. What fleas it didn't kill it attracted more and stirred them up so bad I had to give them a bath with Dawn dish soap which gave more work with my had back
customer_reviews.author: Barb Gruhl

customer_reviews.title: Strong scent, didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The first time we sprayed our dog with this, she had relief almost immediately. She was no longer scratching and biting. I was thrilled! I thought this stuff really worked. Since then, this spray has made no difference in her scratching. She still has fleas. I was really hoping to use something natural, but I guess I’m going to have to use something more potent. The scent is very strong. We sprayed her on the porch so she could air out a bit. I had planned to use it on our area rug she likes to lay on, but the scent filling the house would’ve given me a migraine.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, chemical-less miracle in a bottle!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are no joke— this stuff is legit and works amazingly. We had a small flea infestation in my house bc of my small dog, and this stuff worked so much better than the chemical spray alternative you get at the store. Plus knowing this has no chemicals gave us peace of mind so we could freely spray it on our bedding and around the house without worrying we could be inhaling toxins. The flea infestation was under control quickly, and after the first spray down, we sprayed our entire place again after a week to make sure the eggs died. we now have 3 bottles of this stuff and swear by it.
customer_reviews.author: Kento

customer_reviews.title: Useless Product, Should Have Returned for Full Credit
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviewers have written: This product is useless, it did not kill, nor repel any fleas. Also it must be kept away from cats, as the ingredients are dangerous, if not deadly, for cats. I do not understand why Amazon keeps selling and marketing this product. It is irresponsible. I should have returned this product for a full refund. However, it is nearly impossible to reseal these toxins in the bottle, without likely spilling the fluids all over the packaging. Amazon should classify this product as 'food/spoilage item' and not require returning it, yet issuing a full courtesy refund. I hope someone at Amazon is reading this/listening. I ask for a full refund. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: euromango

customer_reviews.title: Smells great but needs to be more powerful
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I read a great review. Although it is for flea and ticks, I bought it to keep spiders out of bins and lawn furniture without hurting my cat, which is similar to the review I read. It smells great, and I really like the mint fragrance. I spray it around the sliding glass doors, and on the lawn furniture, but it doesn't make a difference to the spiders at all. I think the problem is that it washes off too quickly, and safe for pets is not strong enough for the critters. Having said all that, it is still better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: CeD

customer_reviews.title: 5 STARS!
customer_reviews.text: I sprayed it outside by my slider and my windows and went back out about an hour later, tons of dead knats all over. I cant really judge the longevity because nothing will meet up to my standards, as soon as it rains it needs to be done again or even daily. ***BEWEARE:*** check for your pets ALLERGIES (and with your VET) BEFORE using near them , you never know!
customer_reviews.author: laehm

customer_reviews.title: Not for keeping fleas down continuously
customer_reviews.text: The product indicates it will kill fleas (adult and juvenile) as well as eggs and larve. Well, it kills on contact, but we're still getting wrapped up with babies after treating the rooms three times this week. When I spray it on my feet - when they wrap my feet up - they die in contact. But, it just doesn't seem to do anything in the room. It's a concrete floor, so there's no carpet for them to hide in. Very disappointing. Was hopeful and set this up on a subscription. Cancelled the subscription and wishing we had never purchased. Waste of money. Going back to Adams Flea and Tick.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Langston

customer_reviews.title: ******WARNING******* Toxic to our dog
customer_reviews.text: Our dog began to vomit and skin turned red after using this product. We took him to the vet and $336 later were told that some of the ingredients in this product can cause severe reactions in dogs. I would also mention that on the side of the bottle it says keep out of reach of children and call a physician immediately if ingested.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: scent is extremely overpowering!
customer_reviews.text: The scent is extremely overpowering even when very lightly sprayed. Gave my small older dog coughing fits and me a headache. My large dog is sneezing. On top of this is doesn't seem to work very well (maybe because I spray so lightly because of scent.) When even lightly spray on dogs it become a almost soapy-like consistency that I have to end up wiping off. Do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: betty batten

customer_reviews.title: This is a great deal on a product that works
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal on a product that works! I have three beagles and this past summer, there was a rabbit issue in our backyard. Rabbits = tons of fleas. If I spotted a live flea on a dog, I would spray a paper towel and then hold the paper towel on the area of the dog and it would instantly kill the flea! No more hunting for fleas with a tweezers! I try not to use Frontline or those other flea things, because of how toxic they are. This is a natural alternative, that I would use on myself! The long review is simply because I wish more people would realize how AWFUL Frontline is for your dog!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Sonic

customer_reviews.title: Not sold on it!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really sold on this product. I got 2 fur babies.. My puggles is miserable with fleas... This product seems to kill what I spray directly.. Like on my socks.. Or on my couch.. I spray my puggle..... Rub it in... Used 2 bottles in 2 wks and still got fleas... He gets bathed regular.... Fleas are bad this year but I must need a 5 gallon bucket!! And these, nozels on bottle suck... Screwed on good but leaks bad...keep bottle up right after opening.... Not sure I'll purchase, again... Smh..
customer_reviews.author: Mary Arbogast

customer_reviews.title: Smell is a bit strong when first sprayed
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product. The clove smell can get a little over powering but it's not so bad if you spray and leave for a few hours. We had a flea problem In our apartment and I didnt want to keep using chemicals with 2 kids around, so I got this and was pleased to see that after only using it a few times that the fleas had dissapeared. We have no animals in our apartment so that probably helped also.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for English Springer Spaniel w/sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Kills fleas instantly. We had an issue with our pup going to a family member's house that had fleas in their yard and she came home literally infested. She had on a soresto collar which is a joke. I will be leaving a review on that too! But this stuff is amazing! My girl has very sensitive skin and the smell is not pleasant but it works wonders! I sprayed it on her and rubbed it to her skin like the directions say and it kills fleas immediately. I sprayed it on our furniture to make sure we can kill everything we can. I also got the yard spray. Absolutely satisfied!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how well things work when you follow directions lol
customer_reviews.text: ok; so we were griping about this in the beginning but then we said "Hey; maybe we should read the directions (yes, this is being written by a man if you couldn't already tell)". Well, when we swept and then sprayed, almost every flea disappeared. We account for the few remaining being the result of the cat spending a lot of time outside. We will do a 2nd application in a few weeks to make sure we stay on top of it. I definitely would now recommend this product but with the emphasis on following directions hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: what am i doing wrong????? this stuff does not work for me. i'm going nuts.
customer_reviews.text: i'm losing my mind. i keep spraying and spraying. worried about my pets now. it seems to be okay for a while and then i'm getting bitten again. what am i doing wrong?????? 22000 great reviews and this????? i can't see the fleas because i can't see but i have to believe that i hit some of them. please help me. i'm close to getting pest control to have a flea bomb. talk about being bad for my pets. i sprayed it on my ankles and legs and they are just leaping to other parts of my body. i have cancer and that is nothing compared to this. never ever ever....
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Knight

customer_reviews.title: Stinks!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Smelled to holy high hell. This product works great but everyone in the house complained when I used it. I even sprayed both dogs outside and let them stay outside for awhile. I had to throw away the bottle and buy a similar product in petsmart that didn’t smell as bad. Again works amazing but smells horrible
customer_reviews.author: Joy I. Lefort

customer_reviews.title: Effective (but harsh on the lungs)
customer_reviews.text: I really like this spray. Most importantly, it is effective (I would say it needs to be sprayed ~1x a week for a flea problem). I really (!!!) like that it's a natural product without any harsh chemicals. That being said, even though there aren't any artificial chemicals, the odor is so strong that I would HIGHLY recommend using in a ventilated area (if possible). My dog wouldn't let me spray him directly, so I sprayed it on a brush and then brush it on him. I have successfully sprayed our dog's beds and the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: ALLFLUKSD

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant smell, but doesn't quite work...
customer_reviews.text: So I guess it's flea season and my little shiba got fleas from being outside/near other dogs! We have been using a flea collar, but to no avail, so we thought to triple up and also use the topical frontline treatment and home spray. We started off with vacuuming all our upholstery and then applying the home spray. Most of the fleas fell off our dog in just a few days, but we were still getting bit on our couch after a week! We applied the spray 2x throughout the week and are trying to not do too much (prop 65 warning and all...). Slightly disappointed it doesn't quite work as strongly as we thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: G Satko

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Our rental house we moved into had fleas and we didn't know. Our pup was covered and we were getting bit I sprayed everything down with this and made sure the carpet and blankets were damp. It smells amazing and worked quickly. We even added a small spray on our dog. It didn't affect her but did kill the fleas. We haven't had a problem since. I spray everything down once a month just in case. We are going on almost 4 months of no fleas!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Maybe if your dog is an outside dog??
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it’s like a stink bomb went off wherever I sprayed it. It lingers in the air no matter how I try to air out the scent with the windows open/air purifier on. (And a little goes a long way) I don’t know if the smell is suppose to help in killing the fleas or not. But its killing my nose and giving me head aches. And, if it’s effecting me this much I can just imagine how the smell is messing with my dog’s nose. So if your dog is an outside dog ( sleeps-dog house outside/spends most time outside) then this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: maiyheart

customer_reviews.title: How can so many be happy when it did not work at all for us?
customer_reviews.text: How is it posssible to get all these glowing reviews when it did not work AT ALL forme? We have a dog we call the tick magnet. He runs in the weeds"hunting" and we pull ticks off him everyday. I bought 2 of these, one for my dog and one for the "tick magnet:, a friends dog. We sprayed the dog THOROUGHLY and covered him totally. We walked and the ticks are still jumping on him as if we did nothing at all. He hated the smell too. I do not know why people say it works, IT DOES NOT.
customer_reviews.author: Patsfan

customer_reviews.title: Great but ever changing price?
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s weaker than some sprays so can be used on pets but I used it this year and didn’t seem to get any fleas. We had them last year and by some miracle we were OK this year. I also spray this in the yard to deter mice and mosquitos with mixed results. My gripe is that they are constantly changing the price so if you sign up for Subscribe and Save be sure to check the price every single month especially during the summer as they seem to take advantage of the season.
customer_reviews.author: N M

customer_reviews.title: This really works! (Really!)
customer_reviews.text: This works! After a infestation of fleas, we tried several options (including bug bombs). This is the only product that truly worked immediately. True to an earlier posted review, if you spray on your legs and walk into the room- the flea jump on you and die immediately. After spraying the room (and under the bed) for a couple of days, every flea was gone! We now also spray this on the dogs as they go out and come back in. The preemptive spraying has kept the fleas away. Be warned, it smells strongly of the essential oils used. It doesn’t bother me but some people may have a hard time with it.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Keane

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work and cat will hate you. I wanted so badly to avoid spot-on ...
customer_reviews.text: Nnnnoope... Doesn't work and cat will hate you. I wanted so badly to avoid spot-on treatments and go natural... but after talking to a personal vet friend for awhile who was very candid, I learned it just doesn't work.. it can mitigate it, maybe make it undetectable for some until extreme cold or heat finishes the job, but generally it won't work and your cat will hate you for spraying them with mint and cedar every day.. He suggested Cheristin. After 2 months of failing to have natural methods work, 1 dose of Cheristin solved the whole thing. Never had to give a second dose. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: E. C. Whittington

customer_reviews.title: NO WAY!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this works or not but it cannot possibly be a healthy alternative for your pet! I sprayed my dog's blanket (1 blanket!) and the smell was so overpowering it made me gag. I had to put the blanket in a different room. I got a few drips on my hand while spraying and rinsed it off. I HAVE LOST MY SENSE OF TASTE SINCE YESTERDAY!!!! I can't imagine what this might do to my 8 pound Chi!! DO NOT PURCHASE THIS!!
customer_reviews.author: NW Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Great at killing fleas!
customer_reviews.text: Does well at killing the fleas. They pretty much die instantly. Once the spray hits them. My dogs do not like the spray, but it doesn't seem to give them any allergic reactions. I do notice that it doesn't do well at repelling the fleas. Only killing them. My dogs do have fewer fleas now. I only find 3 throughout the day which is better than before when I would find 6. So for killing fleas it's excellent and repelling it is okay so far. I only spray my dogs twice a week and I spray their bedding once a week
customer_reviews.author: PokeJackie

customer_reviews.title: The Tick lives on.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work for fleas as far as I can retell but not for ticks. I have a tick I’ve pulled off my daughter 😑 in a baggie with the spray in there covering it. It’s been 30 mins and the creep is still fighting for its life. That’s 30 mins it could be pumping junk into my dog. Or anything or anyone else. Kinda breaks my heart. I thought it was protecting my dog.
customer_reviews.author: RunninTheGoodRace

customer_reviews.title: Great smelling and working Natural Tick/Flea Spray
customer_reviews.text: Very wonderful scent!! This product works exactly like it’s description; no ticks on my two little dogs and this has kept their beds flea and tick free for months. I have a recurring subscription and it’s really worth it!!! I use it on my kitchen spot rugs also and we are a flea and tick free home. I’m really pleased I read lots of reviews and ordered this product! It works for me and my 2 pets for over 8 months continuing.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Galarza

customer_reviews.title: Great deterrent
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t like cloves, take a few hours to go to the store while the smell settles—this smells like cloves. The dogs hate the smell, but they stop giving me the stink eye after an hour. I do get less stink eye that the chemical spray. It seems to work as a preventative. ***if you have a flea infestation you will need to upgrade to Dawn dish soap and the tubes (frontline, Kirkland, etc)*** this seems to be a good deterrent. I’ve used it during spring and the dogs don’t seem to get their yearly fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren A.

customer_reviews.title: Toxic product.
customer_reviews.text: Are 6,000+ people really writing reviews about a flea spray? When I first sprayed this I start coughing from the mist then it gave me a headache. I can only imagine what my dog was feeling. It goes on like soap; it foams and bubbles when you massage it into your pet. I sprayed it directly onto a flea and the flea was still moving around for some time. Lastly, this product contains a very small amount of clove and peppermint and 96% of other questionable ingredients including sodium benzoate a known carcinogen. I will not be using this on my pet anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: This and some flea shampoo does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I bought some flea killer shampoo and gave my dog a full bath. Then I dusted all the carpet where the dog can go with this spray and it did the trick. I was anticipating having to give him a second bath, as remaining fleas in the area will jump back on for a ride. But after one bath and a thorough dusting, my infestation was over. Will use it again when he gets more uninvited guests. I even tested the solution to see if it worked. Put some of the flea eggs in a dish, and gave it a couple squirts of the spray. They started dissolving immediately. Can't argue with those results.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

product_meta.title: Vet's Best Flea and Tick Home Spray | Flea Treatment for Dogs and Home | Flea Killer with Certified Natural Oils
product_meta.description: Size:8 ozVet's Best Flea and Tick Spray (8 oz) uses a unique blend of peppermint oil and eugenol (from clove plants) to kill fleas, flea eggs, and ticks by contact. Also repels mosquitoes! Our formulas are independently tested and proven effective at killing and repelling pests like fleas, ticks, and mosquitoes. For use on dogs and puppies 12 weeks or older. The non-staining plant-based flea and tick killing formula is also great for home surfaces like furniture, bedding, carpets, flooring, and curtains – anywhere these pests may hide! For over 30 years, Vet’s Best has blended plant-based ingredients that work together to comfort and protect your pet.
